page.title: 19Landscape,Brenchley&Matfield
page.content: This area is set in undulating countryside with farmland,orchards, hopgardens and woodland.Rivers,ponds and lakes abound. There are mainly narrow country lanes with a section of the A21. Buildings are sparcely scattered _ farm houses, barns,cottages and some private residences,mostly pre 1940. Brattles Grange is an impressive Tudor house, originally a{Wool Hall}built in 1509. Other{houses}are built in the typical Kentish style with hanging tiles or weatherboarding. Several{oast houses and{Kent barns}have recently been converted into housing. Kent barns have timber weatherboards beneath hipped tiled rooves.An old barn at Chillmill is being restored. There are{no schools,shops etc.}in the area.Few are served by buses and most depend on private transport.
